column3: Shouldn't we retain "testnet" for compatibility, for now?

> Shouldn't we retain "testnet" for compatibility, for now?\n\nNow that it's client-side, IMO there's no strict need for keeping compatibility at all (you could always use a different `bitcoin-cli` executable). We've already let this linger for way too long.
utACK https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15566/commits/890396cbd504b4670597d39ecb037e69ffb8bd3e\n\nnit: I also like the idea of explicit deprecation
